title: Kurask

properties.value: Kurask are slayer monsters that require a Slayer level of 70 to damage, as well as usage of leaf-bladed weapons, broad bolts, broad arrows, amethyst broad bolts, or Magic Dart. Kurask are immune to poison and venom. Kurask are also immune to damage from a dwarf multicannon and thralls.

Kurask are slayer monsters that require a Slayer level of 70 to damage, as well as usage of leaf-bladed weapons, broad bolts, broad arrows, amethyst broad bolts, or Magic Dart. Kurask are immune to poison and venom. Kurask are also immune to damage from a dwarf multicannon and thralls.

Their attacks are relatively inaccurate due to their low attack level, but can hit somewhat high if they do.

Although kurask are invulnerable to any damage from the eldritch nightmare staff, Saradomin godsword and toxic blowpipe special attacks, they will still heal the player as if it would have dealt damage, making them useful as special attack weapons during extended trips. The ancient mace special attack also restores Prayer points equal to what damage would have been dealt. Guthan's does not work.

These monsters, along with Turoth, drop the leaf-bladed sword. They are also known for their light mystic robe top and kurask head drops, as well as being the only monster to drop the exclusive leaf-bladed battleaxe.

Location[edit | edit source]

Location Levels Members Spawns Map
Fremennik Slayer Cave10614Maplink
Iorwerth Dungeon10614Maplink
  • Fremennik Slayer Dungeon: Slayer rings offer immediate access to this dungeon, via the Rellekka slayer cave option. For those players without access to slayer rings, a fairy ring (code: AJR) is conveniently located outside the dungeon. Other alternatives include the lyre and Teleport to House if the player's house is located in Rellekka.
  • Fremennik Slayer Dungeon (upper level, Slayer task only)
  • Iorwerth Dungeon in Prifddinas after completing Song of the Elves
A safespot available on the east side of the task-only area.
Safespot in the southern-most kurask section of Iorwerth Dungeon.

Drops[edit | edit source]

Drop rates estimated based on 480,493 kills from the Drop Rate Project, unless otherwise cited.

The average Kurask kill, including unique drops, is worth 4,545.

The average Kurask kill while on a Konar task is worth 6,544.46.

For Kurask in the Iorwerth Dungeon, the average kill is worth 5,293 due to the additional chance of receiving a crystal shard as a tertiary drop. This value for crystal shards assumes that they are made into divine super combat potions.

Combat Achievements[edit | edit source]

The following Combat Achievement tasks involve kurask.

Name Description Difficulty Category
Master of Broad Weaponry Kill a Kurask. Medium Kill count

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
23 August 2018
(update)

The drop of 10–20 limpwurt roots (added in the previous drop table rebalance) was changed to a single limpwurt seed to balance the influx of limpwurt roots coming into the game.

15 September 2016
(update | poll)

The drop table was improved to include more valuable drops and increase quantity of existing drops as well as drop some as banknotes.

23 January 2014
(update | poll)

The leaf-bladed sword is now dropped by Kurask and Turoth.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • There is a single Kurask with a slightly larger appearance in the Fremennik Slayer Dungeon, in the non-task area. This Kurask differs only in its size and has an altered examine text which reflects its increased stature.
